body:
Currently in a straw man state, I wouldn't yet merge this. The feature I want:

``` bash
spack repo add https://www.github.com/DavidPoliakoff/some_package_repository.git
```

To download the given github package and add it as a repo (this will be useful for site-local collections of spack packages)

Some questions remain:
- How do we get the fetch strategy from the url (in fetch_strategy.py, the function from_url, currently a straw man)?
- Where do we want these repositories to live? Right now I have them being stored in a package underneath the main repo, but could as easily see them living at the same level as the builtin collection of packages.

Thoughts? This is as much an issue with a strawman attached as a PR.
title: [WIP] Feature/remote repo
